thread.title: Where have we seen that dress before?
thread.title_full: Where have we seen that dress before?

title: Where have we seen that dress before?
text:
Email a friend 
THE 2015 seasons of The Bachelor and The Bachelorette have been plagued with rumours of budget cuts, as producers abandoned the exotic locations of previous seasons and took a more low key approach. 
Watching Sam Wood say “I love you” to Snezana Markoski in Sydney didn’t have quite the same thrill as Season two’s exotic South African finale. And it seems The Bachelorette producers were also trying to cut costs. 
During last night’s finale, when Sam Frost chose Sasha Mielczarek as her beau, she wore a dress identical to a gown previously worn by The Bachelor intruder Rachel Moore during her first meeting with Sam Wood. 
The hand-embroidered Philippa Galasso gown retails for $6,320 and is encrusted with Swarovski beads. Sam Frost wearing a Philippa Galasso gown during Thursday night’s finale. Source: Channel 10 Rachel Moore arrived as an intruder at The Bachelor mansion during Episode 9. Source: Channel 10 
The 29-year-old food blogger was brought in as an intruder towards the end of the season, along with runner-up Lana Jeavons-Fellows. 
Rachel was unpopular with viewers and was soon eliminated from the show. She was later accused of “fat shaming” fellow contestant Nina Rollestone 
“Nina’s got no concern, she eats junk food and she’s trying to get a guy,” Moore said in a piece to camera. 
“Nina would brag about how she doesn’t like health and fitness and she doesn’t work out and she eats junk food. If Sam wants all of that, that’s his deal.”
